Me: that's not "techno", and for god's sake, no generalizing! There are many subclutures of electronic music.

you're having an affect on me, boy-o. ^-^
Have you ever woken up and had such BAD MORNING BREATH that your nose got angry at you because it was placed so close to your mouth? Yeah, I have that.
Why is it that whenever John and I talk about college and how we may have to be far apart, I always cry?

Armed With Girlfriend by San Renard. XD I couldn't help myself. He's just so great. Been watching PGSM. Rissie's right: MANY MANY PANTY SHOTS. But fun all the same. Sailor Moon is STILL a dithering idiot, but hey, some things never change. <-< LOVES!
Gabe and Tycho from Penny Arcade are my new heroes.

Now that I think about it, I feel bad for what I said to my boyfriend at the game. He asked about going to Denny's, and in retrospect it seemed like I was almost discouraging him from going, but all I was doing was wanting to make sure he didn't strain himself because I knew that I was really tired. I dunno, I feel bad. ><; I like doing things with him sooooo much, I just don't want him to be suffering on my account.

Jane Goodall tomorrow, dance saturday, cheesy rice on the stove now. Darn you for making me crave. >< I love you, dear. Sorry if I was ragging on you today. Kinda in the dumps. Frustrated at myself. But that's life. Here's a picture that reminds me of something you'd draw: Lake I didn't do it, someone named Denis Oliver did. *shrug*
Life is wonderful and good and beautiful!!

Zaba Search This site is an instant directory to almost any person in the US and a good deal of their personal information. Kids are not usually targetted, because they don't have many public records (which all of the information is collected from) but adults are most certainly on here. People can get an array of information, ranging from home address and telephone number all the way up to credit card number and social security number. So not only is this person/these people giving out vital information, but they obviously have far too much time on their hands.

I'm in the business of making cosplay animal ears!! WOOT! So exciting. I don't charge much (in other words, I don't make that much profit, cuz these things are expensive!!) but here are my prices if anyone's interested. KITTY Basic kitty ears = $12 Basic kitty ears w/ matching colour covered headbands = $15 Basic kitty ears w/ accessories = varies DOGGY Basic doggy ears = $14 Basic doggy ears w/ matching colour covered headbands = $16 Basic doggy ears w/ accessories = varies The ears come in black, white, pink, or yellow, but I can make them in other colours if you ask. My accessories include things like lace, ribbon, studs, gems, bows, charms, patches, etc. I can also make custom ears, or different animals. Totally open to new things. ^^ (back to the journal) THIS IS SO EXCITING!! I feel like I'm really getting out there and doing something, ya know? It's so exciting; like I'm a real-live costume maker!! I can't WAIT to start selling these puppies on e-bay! X3 LOVE!!

CHANGE THE WORLD! - v6 (jpns)- GREAT SONG

Ahhhh me. What a great movie. I bought "The Cat Returns" on my limo ride yesterday (more on that later) and have just finished watching it for the second time. I viewed it first in Japanese with subtitles (the only way. The directors in Japan know EXACTLY who's voice fits who, so they get it right the first time.) and then in English, respectively. Now I have looked up some of the english seyuues, or voice over artists. I must say, it is an all-star cast. The main character is Anne Hathaway, which most of you may recognize as Ella from Ella Enchanted, or Mia from The Princess Diaries (1 and 2). The supporting actor is Cary Elwes, which some of you may recognize as Robin Hood, from Robin Hood: Men in Tights, or Westley, from The Princess Bride. YUP. I was soooooo happy! Cary Elwes playing a smoothe, devonair cat (statue) who wears a tux complete with top hat and cane!! *drooooooooooool* It was smexy.

Anyway, time to check out el special features. Too-cool. <3's!
there's something far-too satisfying about sitting, reading, drinking a Coke, eating cold pizza, listening to good music, in your underwear.

In the beginning, something in me just wasn't clicking. I usually adore Nick Hornby, but this book just... I dunno. Maybe it was because he was doing a rather poor job of projecting that, indeed, his protagonist was female. This is something I would not reccommend of him. He is a wonderful writer of the male mind and male view; his interpretation of the female view is partially inaccurate, and partially idiotic. I can understand a good deal of it, sure. He does a fair enough job. But when a woman calls her husband to remind him to write a not for their daughter's dentist appointment and the husband rants about how she never calls just to call, things seem skewed.

Further on in the book, however, things become more soulful and in-depth. Things become more realistic, although it is completely fanciful. A DJ comes to live with them who is a spiritual healer who, supposedly, attained mystical healing powers from ingesting too much Extacy in his clubs. Compete fantasy, but the understanding of life and the world that comes from it is not. That understanding has brought out some great lines, and in turn, I have begun to highlight. Any author who's book recieves my flourescant glow on their page has something to reckon for. That is a seal of approval in my book (no pun intended).

Although I am only halfway-ish done, it seems that How to be Good might live up to the last word in it's title.
being moderate, I can laugh at this. Can you? XD

sitting here, thinking, waiting for the Star Wars blooper reel to finish burning. Blah.

So many things, places, people, faces, to think about. Where does one possibly begin? In this melancholy world, who can honestly say that their minds do not wander to sad places and sad faces and situations and dreams that make them break inside. When listening to sad music, one begins to imagine what life might be like... differently. If that one person did something terrible; if that one friend betrayed you; if that one pet died; etc, etc, life goes on. What would it be like if all you knew was sadness? No happy sparks. No happy anything. A dull, uneventfull slough of mild depression.

This song reminds me of that life. The life I do not have. The life I think about, occaisionally. When I hear songs like this. The reminder that life can change. The reminder that tears fall, that things dissappear, that hearts can break.

I have a life so filled with happy sparks that I could power three continents for a hundred years. Tears fall, but they can fall with happiness. Things dissappear, but can be found again. Hearts break so that they can mend.

Life is only as wonderful as your attitude allows it to be. ^_^

RAWR!! Okay. I was playing ROSE last night, and was like "why am I so tired? The clock on the microwave says 12:30... Hey, I have work, I aught to go to bed." So I clicked off and the clock on the COMPUTER said 2:30. I was like "...." and then remembered that we had lost power earlier so all of the clocks in the house were off except the comp. My mind: oh f%(#@! So I popped myself into bed as fast as I could. 7:00 am - *RING RING* "Hello, honey? When are you coming over today? I can come get you now, or in an hour when-" *groggy*"Mom, you DO realize that I have work today, don't you?" "OH DARNIT! I forgot!" "I'll see you after work." And back to bed. 10:00 - *RING RING* "Hiya! Is your dad there? It's ________ from the tallship Lynx. I just wanted to verify such and such." "he'll call you when he gets in." "Oh, is this ____? You're going too, right? Are you excited?!" "I'd be more excited if I was AWAKE." "Ohmigosh! I'm sooo sorry, I-" "That's fine. Bye." What a frikkin morning. But I just look at my avatar and it makes me happy. ^_^()

Whee~! Yesterday was sooo much fun! I had to clean the garage (not fun) but then J came over!! And he passed his driving test!!! :dance dance dance: Yippee!!! I <u>knew</u> you could do it, darlin'! We were gonna go to a movie, but it was packed so we rented one and went home. Actually, we ended up watching one that I already owned. But anyway, before going home we went for Chinese food, then ran around a bit, THEN went home. So blah.

Home, snuggle down, movie. It was a cute movie; I think he liked it, but I dunno. Then we sorta watched Finding Neverland, but ah well. We really talked for most of the evening about anything and everything. I feel so blessed that I can talk to him with such ease and I know that he will keep what I say in his heart, something for just him and I to share. He's one of the most kindhearted, trustworthy people I have ever met. It's so cool; he's my boyfriend, and my best friend. *smiles* :heart:

You are a Mermaid, who sits on a rock in
the sea, looking and watching all humanity with
curiosity in your eyes. You have a two-sided
personality - On one hand, you revel in your
freedom and often prefer to live in your own
private dreams and on the other hand, humanity
intrigues you and you love watching on.

You
are actually very kind at heart and, hating to
see people hurt, you despise injustice. You
probably have one or two special friends, who
mean the world to you.

Also; you are probably
quite political, wanting to see justice done in
the world.

You are quite the dreamer, needing
your freedom and personal space to dream your
little dreams. You love to escape into a book
or some good music and just drift away.

Some
of your good points are that you are sensitive,
compassionate and a freethinker. Your bad
points are that you may come across as cool and
aloof to others and probably have a tendency to
depression.

You are the ultimate dreamer with
a kind - yet troubled heart.

There's a quote from Slaughterhouse-Five that I absolutely love. These three soldiers are trying to find a kitchen in a communal refugee-ish area, and they accidentally stumble into the girls' shower. They open the door to find thirty teenage girls showering completely bare together. The line was:

"They covered themselves with their hands and turned their backs and so on, and made themselves utterly beautiful."

I thought that was a great line, because it personifies how beautiful innocence is. These girls have been thorugh bombings and horrors and things people only dream about in nightmares and they still shriek and scramble like schoolgirls do when a boy accidentally stumbles into the girls' locker room instead of the boys' because he lost his glasses and couldn't read the sign. I dunno, I just like the symbol of beauty in innosence.

Hoping ever so much to fall asleep and dream lovely dreams of lovely things and lovely scenes... mmm... *hugs herself*

I'm being silly. ^.^

I got my glorious programs today. Bryce 5 and Ray Dream Studio. It was so beautiful... The manuals were like sacred tomes in my trembling fingers. Then I looked at the box. "Reccomended use with Windows 95".

I wanted to cry.

Sprawled out on my chair in front of the computer, painting, listening to French music, munching listlessly on a sandwich, thinking.



Yeah, I feel like I'm in a film.

So much on my mind...

The beginning of a poem which I wrote

But hoarded from the view of others

A secret note for me and me alone

To read and smile

A memory

A sweet rememberance

Of a sweet, sweet event

For me and me alone to read forever

And for those who I may share my poem with

(if I choose to do so, which is unlikely)




So much on my mind...

The beginning of a poem

Interesting story in the news lately. A woman was going to get married to this guy, then one morning about 12 days ago she dissappeared. Of course the police came down hard on the man and the girl's family. The husband-to-be had to take a lie test and all this jazz. They found her the other day. She had gotten cold feet and run away without telling anyone, thinking that they wouldn't go looking for her or something.

Can you spell 'idiot'?

I can understand getting cold feet, but after the whole 'Laci Peterson' deal, you DON'T RUN AWAY!!! God, that poor man... think about how he must've felt: The love of his life dissappears, he gets the evil eye from everyone about being a possible murderer, has to take a lie test, has to answer all these questions, then they find the wife-to-be and she says that she was scared. WELL THANKS! That's reassuring, honey! I'm glad that you were so afraid that you ran away without telling any of us possibly to start a new life for yourself while you left me here to ROT and possibly get time in JAIL for the chance that I may have MURDERED YOU. GOD WOMAN! Seriously, what in the blue hell goes through some people's minds.
BUT, I did find a really cool picture on-line of something that someone made with that program I'm gonna get in a few days from my cousin:

what a day.

I can't even talk about it right now.

Eating one of my fave snacks: Cup 'o Noodles, no juice, with pepperjack cheese melted into it.

in pyjamas

recovering.



I'll talk about it later. Right now, I just don't wanna think for a while.
